intro: Gaultheria stereophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf wintergreen, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, dark red berries that are edible and have a sharp, spicy flavor. Gaultheria stereophylla thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in temperate rainforests. Its botanical features make it a notable species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
